speaker: Card Table
lines: Cards fan like wings; someone shuffles with one hand and drinks with the other.
A coin tips, wobbles, and settles with a soft ring.
'Table stakes are stories or silver,' says a woman with a laugh that knows both.
The deck smells faintly of smoke and promises.
A spoon taps a glass and you realize you've been dealt in.
Three faces look like they know you already; two probably do.
A dog under the table watches your hands and waits.
It is not you unless you change that.

choices.text: Lose gracefully and buy a round.
Accuse a cheat and flip the table.
